TRIAGE-1_threshold_test.question: Does sub-linear scaling hold at original threshold τ=0.1?
TRIAGE-1_threshold_test.hypothesis: Bit-cost scales sub-linearly: B(N) ~ N^β where β < 1

tau_0_1_original.interpretation: Sub-linear scaling strongly validated (β < 1 with high confidence)

tau_0_25_current_code.interpretation: Super-linear scaling refuted at this threshold (β > 1 entirely)

TRIAGE-1_threshold_test.key_insight: Contradiction resolved: τ=0.1 (original) validates hypothesis; τ=0.25 (code drift) does not. Use τ=0.1 throughout paper.
TRIAGE-1_threshold_test.paper_impact: Add 2 sentences to Section 6.2 explaining threshold selection

TRIAGE-2_metric_normalization.question: Does adaptive gate normalization fix RES-069's cross-resolution divergence?
TRIAGE-2_metric_normalization.hypothesis: Normalized metric maintains ρ > 0.8 across resolutions

original_metric_correlation.name: order_multiplicative_v1
original_metric_correlation.issue: Perfect correlation but large magnitude drop (metric unstable)

normalized_metric_correlation.name: order_multiplicative_v2
normalized_metric_correlation.improvement: Reduced drift by 14%; excellent correlation maintained

implementation.purpose: Scale-invariant order metric for cross-resolution comparison

TRIAGE-2_metric_normalization.paper_impact: Add 80-word paragraph to Section 2.2 explaining scale normalization

TRIAGE-3_alignment_principle.question: Does thermodynamic alignment hold at 64×64 with normalized metric?
TRIAGE-3_alignment_principle.hypothesis: Architecture order alignment predicts reconstruction quality: r < -0.6

correlation_pearson.interpretation: Very strong negative correlation (high-order = high quality)

TRIAGE-3_alignment_principle.key_insight: Clear two-tier pattern: high-order achieves near-perfect reconstruction, low-order fails completely
TRIAGE-3_alignment_principle.paper_impact: Add validation note to Section 5.10 with correlation statistics

contradiction_1.issue: RES-009 claims sub-linear (β<1) but finds β=1.45
contradiction_1.root_cause: Threshold mismatch: documentation said τ=0.1, code used τ=0.25
contradiction_1.resolution: TRIAGE-1 confirms β=0.796 at τ=0.1 (validates original hypothesis)

contradiction_2.issue: RES-069: order metrics diverge with resolution (opposite trends)
contradiction_2.root_cause: Edge gate hardcoded for 32×32; scales incorrectly at 64×64

contradiction_3.issue: Alignment principle untested at 64×64; RES-069 suggests metric problems
contradiction_3.root_cause: RES-069's metric instability cast doubt on cross-resolution comparisons
contradiction_3.resolution: TRIAGE-3 validates alignment at 64×64 with normalized metric (r=-0.931)

section_2_2_order_metrics.change: Add new paragraph on scale normalization

section_5_1_prior_volume.change: Specify resolution and threshold for 10^21× speedup claim
section_5_1_prior_volume.to: At 32×32 resolution with τ=0.1, CPPN requires ~2 bits

section_5_10_alignment.text: We validate this alignment principle at 64×64 resolution using the scale-normalized metric, finding strong correlation between reconstruction quality and order proximity to natural-image structure (Pearson r=-0.931, p=0.021).

section_6_2_limitations.change: Expand threshold discussion with specific β values
key_points: β depends on threshold: τ=0.1 → β≈0.80, τ=0.25 → β≈1.45

appendix_a5_optional.change: Add technical details on scale invariance derivation
